p: Where T is the projected temperature for future years (°C) and T o is the base temperature (°C) at the stage of construction when the joints were installed. Thus, the superstructure of the bridge will expand from T o to T (maximum temperature of exposition), and contracts from T o to the minimum temperature of exposition. During instalation, and to ensure proper performance, when T o is at mid range (average of maximum and minimum temperature that the bridge is subjected), the joint can be set at mid movement range. However, if T o is above or below the mid range, the joint gap needs to be reduced or increased, respectively [ 38]. In this study, the temperature variation ΔT is considered constant along the bridge length and depth.
